please_describe: More police presence.  Thank you!

air quality :  Landscapers and all the diesel machines used, terrible noise.
                    Idling cars and trucks. https://www.newroads.ca/blog/reasons-to-stop-idling-vehicle/
                    The proliferation of grossly large SUV's pickup trucks. noticed the kids from daycare, nurseries are 
                    at tailpipe levels.
                    Semi sized delivery trucks ????? 
                     Safe bike lanes. I would be happy to ride a bike but no respect for bike lanes.
Include bike safety as part of traffic safety. We need more dedicated bike lanes that are safe enough for our kids to ride in.
n/a

The only PUBLIC HIGHSCHOOL in the ward isn't even listed. WOW. The list is a joke by not even mentioning that. Pity, just like the state of the City and all Public Schools, especially in the ward where Parker continues to buy up all the real estate and Latin and Parker own public land but Oz Park was sold to a private operator and LPHS never got the field or even gym they were promised and deserve.

THE LANDMARKED COBBLESTONE ALLEY WHICH RUNS EAST AND WEST BETWEEN GENEVA AND ORCHARD WAS DESTROYED 5 YEARS AGO AND PATCHED WITH A PATH OF CEMENT. THE APRON TO ORCHARD STREET WAS NEVER INSTALLED CORRECTLY AND CAUSES FLOODING TO ADJACENT HOUSES. IN ADDITION, PEOPLE HAVE BEEN INJURED TRIPPING OVER THE LIP BETWEEN THE APRON AND THE ALLEY. 5 YEARS AGO WE WERE TOLD IT WOULD BE FIXED. NOTHING HAS BEEN DONE.

The constant shootings and robberies in our area. I want to patronize the shops and businesses in my area but I’m a retired older person and I’m afraid to go out in my neighborhood.  
   Im a lifelong liberal democrat who has supported and  marched and donated to help those in need. Im also retired from 38 years of work and now just want to not be afraid in my own neighborhood, yelled at on the sidewalks and constantly intimidated. No more programs Mayor, please, just clean it up. God bless.

I realise you have a category “ public safety “ but I must emphasize that unless the City gets current crime under control and people feel secure again all your other priorities are not relevant . 
Public Safety must be your first , second and third priority . We have lived in the 43 RD Ward for eight years . I am now 75 , my wife 69 . It is very sad to see how much safety has deteriorated in the short time we have lived in beautiful Lincoln Park .
No more tax increases. Enough is enough.

There needs to be stricter rules as our beautiful city is being tormented and ruined but the crooks. Get these people off our streets & into jail for life. Ban guns! Pay police more money to keep us safe. We are the city of big shoulders. Don’t ruin it

Police accountability- It's way past time for rogue police to get off scot-free and have taxpayers compensate victims of police misbehavior. Make them forfeit their pension and put that into the victims' compensation fund rather than the taxpayers bearing all the burden. And the most egregious, like in the case of Laquan McDonald, must be terminated from the force. The police should have skin in the game -  bet they'll think twice before they empty their weapons on civilians.
Better safer bike infrastructure
The number of homeless people in the neighborhood in front of businesses whether begging for money or sleeping preventing employees from getting into their place of employment.
Police support and finding of the CPD.  This is not negotiable. Look what has happened to our beautiful city!!!
Keeping developers and homeowners to Zoning Code. Lincoln Park has an agreeable scale, and mature trees, which attract and keep residents and draws students and tourists.
Fair and transparent application of zoning laws. For example,  Redevelopment of The Cenacle needs further review. Developer is seeking significant variances From existing zoning laws.
more police presence
Smart transportation friendly density is valuable. No interest in a candidate who is anti business and anti development!
Property taxes are WAY TOO HIGH

The process by which Parker is expanding in the neighborhood is extremely concerning. They are not forthright and little by little are consuming parts of their perimeter. They have created a major rift in the neighborhood, usurped parking, eliminated tax base for the ward. Expansion and growth is natural - but it's unfair how they've pursued this round. They need to be open, accountable, and fair.
Taxes!  Camera enforced tickets.  Corruption in city hall.

Crime is out of control.  Many businesses have the option to locate anywhere and they and many of their employees are doing so.  Crime and fear of crime has become a major consideration in choosing to leave Chicago and nearby communities.  Fix the crime issue or face a fast declining population of people with employment opportunities.
Crime is a civic disaster.  Fix the crime problem or Chicago will become another Detroit.
Safety is number one!
Improve pedestrian access between the 43rd Ward and the neighborhoods to the west

CRIME, LACK of PROSECUTION OF CRIMINALS BY KIM FOXX AND SOME JUDGES, BAIL REFORM THAT ALLOWS ALLEGED CRIMINALS THAT ARE DANGEROUS BACK ON THE STREET, CRIME, CRIME, CRIME, LAWS THAT PROTECT 13-18 YEAR OLDS WHO ARE COMMITTING VERY SERIOUS AND DANGEROUS CRIMES AS THEY MAKE CHICAGO UNLIVABLE AND DESTROY VITAL RETAIL DISTRICTS; CONSTRAINTS ON POLICE THAT HINDER THEIR ABILITY TO APPREHEND CRIMINALS; RIDICULOUS CITY MONETARY AWARDS TO INDIVIDUALS OUT OF PROPORTION TO THE HARM THEY ENDURED.

Crime:  armed robberies, carjackings and looting
There are no consequences for the mostly teenagers committing these crimes.
We had 2 crimes across the street from our house.  An armed robbery and a female punched from behind and kicked in the head by 3 additional criminals after she fell down.  The MO is follow the pedestrian by car and jump out of the car and rob or beat up the person.  We captured the crime on our camera and the police came and took the video.

Traffic flow
The overdevelopment being allowed through zoning variance and usual channels, including the new casino site, seems to be a recipe for traffic jams, back-ups, and transportation difficulties.

Partnerships with the school communities in the Ward is so very important.  If issues of any kind arise at school, the Alderperson should be aware.  They should also attend LSC meetings regularly to show support and stay informed and connected to the community—not just do it when it is convenient or there is an upcoming election.
Selecting a competent and experienced individual to replace Michelle Smith.0
Potholes

Parks and other common areas. Several parks - Ogden park, for example, have become totally neglected. 

We need an Alderman that is a doer and not just interested in politics.
Taxes.. schools
Public safety is the most important issue in our ward, followed by improving CTA (safety, cleanliness, and quality/scope of service).
Keeping developers from being allowed to buy and tear down the old residences in Old Town and putting up new condos.   Restoring Old Town’s protected status.
Crime -mugging on the street; need more police coverage- carjackings

Specifically, it is important to prevent the CDOT “Dickens Greenway” project from being implemented. The outgoing Alderman inexplicably approved this Ill-considered project over the strenuous objections of all the local resident associations, ignoring public park and school safety considerations. Any future 43rd Ward Alderman must heed the findings and warnings of the Oz Park Advisory Committee and other local resident associations, and reject the Dickens Greenway plan outright. Thank you.

Safety and freedom to walk this neighborhood without fear of car jacking, random shooting or robbery.  Prosecution of those caught should be  
a priority in fighting crime.
preservation of historic buildings
A municipal sidewalk shoveling service during the winter would be nice.  It is difficult to walk in the ward because people do not shovel in front of their houses.

I have watched our beautiful and safe neighborhood decline. Garbage cans overflowing, increasing empty storefronts and overall unkempt conditions. That is sad but not as tragic as the stark uptick in crime and mayhem. The rash of cars that have been stolen some @ gun point, thefts of items from innocent people @ gunpoint and the hoards of motorcycle drivers shooting their weapons (one bullet hit our bldg) and rising on sidewalks is out of control. Help!
Addressing Safe biking in our ward

Continued gang activities in the 43 rd ward. 
The prevalence of illegal drugs in the community. The continued selling of these dangerous drugs to adults and children! 
The selling and uses of illegal drugs in the night clubs and bars in the 43rd ward. 
Underage drinking at the night clubs and  bars in the 43rd ward.  Young people staggering down the street barely able to stand up. In addition, drunken patrons engaging in disruptive activities, shouting, arguing, fighting, etc.

Approve limited evening use of the field at Francis W. Parker school during the late fall and early spring...which will include lights, focused on the field.. until 9pm.   Week days only.    This was promised years ago and the prior alderman was intimidated by a few neighbors which prevents the grades 6-12 from full use of the field at reasonable times.   This may be some 10-20 games over a 120 day period
Being more supportive of small businesses and NOT shutting them down.
The city, which i once considered clean for a big city is filthy, and parks are in a complete state of decline.  The trees in Lincoln Park are in desperate need of trimming.  The graffiti is awful.
NA

We need a new and better neighborhood high school so all our kids are not fighting to  get into a selective enrollment school or program.  There should be a clear, guaranteed path for quality education through twelfth grade. This should be available to all kids in Chicago, not just LP.  It should be the mayor's top priority.  It's ridiculous that CPS has a $9+ billion annual budget, and still the schools are underfunded.  Where is all the money going?

As a senior citizen, it is imperative that I feel safe in my neighborhood or I will be forced to leave the city.
Public transportation needs dire attention on the safety issue if people are going to use it. If security is necessary on the el's, then provide it or the people will not use it.
N/A
Higher police presence
Stop crime! And reign in real estate taxes.
Squandering tax money by supporting able bodied people who don’t want to work for a living.

Every community member from resident to business owner needs to feel safe to thrive. Crime (and not just petty crime) is Chicago’s biggest problem and embarrassment. How can we work on any other issue, including equity and inclusion, if nobody feels like they can safely walk around the neighborhood at any hour of the day. A safer neighborhood will lead to more business, higher property values, more tax revenue, and thus more money for other things
N/A

When selecting a new Alderman for our ward, please get one that will get back to us and respond. Also consider firing her entire office or retraining them so that they understand the importance of the residence and responding to them. Enough said

The dirt bikes that are illegal and drag racing on Lake Shore have gotten worse since you passed the new ordinance. I see the dirt bikes doing wheelies on pedestrian paths and lakefront walking paths.  Moms with babies, walkers and elderly are fearful and at risk of being run over.  There is a pattern of dirt bikes, drag racing, then mobs gathering at the beaches, the physical fighting begins and then out comes the guns.  CPD is rightfully exhausted.  I have ideas!

Responsible development that doesn’t change the character of the neighborhood. 

Need for more green space and river front change to be an outdoor and accessible asset.

Noise pollution: Our community is losing its value as a liveable neighborhood because large (and loud) trucks are permitted to pass through every street rather than being limited to arterial streets. The major offenders are construction vehicles and trash collection trucks which pass all day every day on my small street.
Historic preservation of architecture.

We need to attract more businesses similar to Southport shopping lake view!!!! I am tired of run down empty storefronts. We also need to clean up the 43rd ward as garbage is everywhere.  We need road improvements as the pot holes on Wrightwood are not getting repaired!
ECPS & Police Oversight
na
Freeze, or preferably roll back, property taxes.

Maintaining the historic character of many parts of the the neighborhood. Too many historic buildings are being torn down and replaced by cookie-cutter condo buildings (out of scale and character) or pseudo-historic new houses. Renovatig/restoring older buildings maintains the character of the neighborhood and is more sustainable in terms of material use and less waste to landfills.
Fighting corruption in this city

Communication and transparency in all government agencies. Improve (or find) use for fallow properties in blighted neighborhoods. 
Better, more engaging youth programs and opportunities for employment. 
Safer gun regulations and better messaging about the cost of the damage guns cause. 
I'm sorry, but SO many of the city's issues feel as if they deserve urgent consideration.
N/A

Responsible development. Specifically, transparency and accountability at the planning commission. A new 7-story tower is planned for construction in our ward. The plans the developer pitched to the neighbors were surreptitiously changed to the detriment of the neighborhood. The plans were nonetheless approved by the planning commission despite the lack of community input. We need an alderperson who will represent the interests of the neighbors and not the interests of non-resident developers.
N/A
Education and schools are perhaps most important.
The city and all neighborhoods need to be safe and they are not right now.

Support of our police is critical to public safety.  It has been severely lacking from the current 
city leaders - specifically the Mayor.
Park Spaces/Green spaces - a neighborhood green space at Lincoln Ave/Halsted/Fullerton intersection has been removed to make way for what appear to be luxury condos, which is too bad.

I just want the new alderman / alderwoman to have a keen eye on public safety, particularly around the issues like carjacking, young people robbing / attacking residents for their phone, wallets, purses, etc.  Safety is a huge concern.

In discussions with others in the community, there is a strong sense that crime is out of control.  Although this may fall under public safety, more needs to be done about the access to weapons and and keeping known and repeat offenders off the street.

More resources for and stronger partnership with the CPD. There are certainly things that will become a priority, but we're currently at the bottom of Maslow's Hierarchy; not being carjacked or held up on the sidewalk has to be the top priority until it is solved.

Tax breaks for long term building owners and small businesses that have been in the neighborhood for decades paying extreme taxes. A great strategy would be to replace Lori Lightfoot and her policies that place an even heavier tax burden on hard working people. Everyone will move out of Illinois if this continues. Owned property since 1984 on armitage and never once a break from the city. Unbelievable.
Crime in our community has risen exponentially.  We can't live in a community where we do not feel safe.

Lincoln Yards impact on existing traffic in the neighborhood.  The inclusion of greenspace and parks within the plans is very important both to the environment and so the space is not filled with highrises.

regarding business development, often with public works and street cleaning happening simultaneously, there often is not anywhere for customers to park within 5-6 blocks of any given business, which cripples a businesses ability to generate revenue. As a business owner AND a patron of the area, If we want businesses to succeed we have to organize these works and street cleaning to allow the public to NOT drive away in frustration. This should be fixed between street and sanitation and utilies

Someone that cares for the little green space we have.  Spends our tax payers money on planting flowers and landscaping our beautiful area.  I doubt it garners much attention from anyone political because politics lately says a lot about our environment but takes few actions.   It wouldn’t hurt to plant a couple trees and flowers every season.  I really enjoyed the tulip giveaway at Garfield park conservatory during 2020.  I thought that was nice.  I hope you choose someone that loves this place

Consistent work of Chicago Public Schools - no CTU strikes, no online learning, no masks. Bring back NWEA/MAP testing. Lincoln Park public schools lost close to 25% of its student population, families are leaving because of the safety concerns, constant CTU led work stoppages and strikes, inadequate education. 
Prosecution of criminals that are currently running wild in our neighborhood.

Stop the installation of the Bike path on Dickens Avenue
Running it through Oz Park (the busiest neighborhood park in the city per Michele Smith) is an accident waiting to happen...
Community engagement in development projects.
Continue tree planting in our ward

We have too MUCH BIKES/SCOOTERS TRAFFIC - CARS ARE AT A DISADVANTAGE IN ADDITION TO TO PAY BACK TO THE CITY IN $$$ - BIKES/SCOTTERS..PAY NOTHING - NOR TAKE ROAD TESTS/INSURANCE/TICKETS  -THEY CUT YOU OFF WITHOUT ANY WARNING - YET THE CITY DOES NOTHING FOR AUTO DRIVERS - HAVE TO TAKE TESTS - BIKE/SCOOTER PEOPLE SHOULD HAVE
TO PASS  TESTS - GET TICKET CHARGES -  WE NEED CHANGE IN POLICIAL DIRECTION - THEY FORGET WHO FEEDS THEM!!!!
Accountability for crimes that include community input
Repurposing the funds for the Dickens Greenway Project to something that is safer and more needed for our city. Advocating for our neighborhood regarding the Lincoln Yards development.
Not allowing builders of new properties the ability to do as they please. Community involvement is a must. Respect to those around these new properties and respect to their existing homes is a must.
The crime rate needs to go down or we are going to need to move to another city.
Crime, carjackings, muggings & assaults

Safety and Police Presence in this community is very important as important in the city as a whole.  The violence we hear and read about is just over the top aweful.  MORE POLICE!!!! They serve and protect and risk their lives for our safety. What is taking so long to recognize this?
Repair trashed intersections, walkways and sidewalks.

Protected bike lanes on Halsted St. 
Too many empty storefronts with trash accumulating around them. Building/business owners need to be held accountable for keeping sidewalks and building entries clear of trash, even if the building/storefront is empty.

I really think we need comprehensive solutions on how to make the ward more affordable for everyone, including upzoning, passing Bring Chicago Home, and other measures to help build more affordable housing.
More responsive city services - such as 311 requests

I want an alderman who will advocate and advance a cooling ordinance which would require high rise buildings to provide air conditioning when the outside temperature is 80 degrees. Too many ailments like diabetes are tragically affected by the lack of a cooling ordinance and home owners associations won’t turn on air until June 1. Meanwhile residents are falling I’ll.
Schools
I view pedestrian/cycling safety and public transit improvements as vital for achieving both our climate and sustainability goals and improving economic development throughout the city.
More Police Officers in our ward.

Crime and public safety are by far and away our number one problem that needs to be addressed. The change in safety parameters of the neighborhood and ability to complete activities of daily living (example: driving) has remarkedly changed over the last several years. This crime has driven out many younger families who were invested in the community and moved or displaced major building and businesses or left them empty. This community is at a major tipping point that affects city as a whole.
Opposition to Lightfoot, Foxx and Evans.
I've lived in this ward for 32 years and the crime has never been worse. Seems like there is no police presence whatsoever!! Do something about it..not just cheap talk!

We must address Unfunded Pensions!!! This is obviously a State and Constitutional issue, as well as a city problem. But it's not even being discussed. Pensions are THE largest financial problem we face ... and will drive all our budget woes. Speaking of woes, pensions obviously impact our dramatically increasing property taxes! 

We should champion the referendum that's needed to modify the so-called "Pension Clause" in the State Constitution. We should be allowed to vote on this crucial issue!

Getting guns and crime out of our ward and out of the entire city is urgent to the future and livability of our ward but the entire future of this city. Juveniles are committing most of the crimes and are released. I am in real estate and I get a call a week from people wanting to get out of the city because they’re  afraid.  We already have equity, inclusion and low income housing in our neighborhood..we need safety.Will miss Ald. Smith’s dedication to court advocacy for victims. We need safety
High property taxes; too many nickel and dime fees and taxes (like 6 mph speed cameras)
Eliminating waste, fraud, incompetence, and corruption in City government and municipal operations.
Quality of life issues like graffiti removal, parks, litter cleanup
Important to have or keep affordable housing
PUBLIC SAFETY... not just on Lightfoot's block, BUT ON MY BLOCK, TOO.
no loitering
Public safety and more police!!!

It relates to public safety but reducing crime is biggest issue. People should be able to go about their business without fear. We must teach people that their alternatives to crime and violence. Dealing with this critical. This must be top priority of alderman.

I cannot believe that Bally's Casino will eventually be located at the old Wrigley newspaper distribution site along the River. It will decrease nearby property values.

Concerns as a neighbor:
1- Halsted St is congested with traffic as it is - this is a main route for Lincoln Park neighborhoods
2- I understand there is no restriction on noise - entertainment activites to take place
3- Potential increase in crime with a casino so close to residential areas
Clean up and care of the neighborhoods - too much garbage, weeds, etc.  this used to be a priority to keep the city clean.

Francis Parker, a private inst, must be curbed from their stranglehold over the neighborhood. Parker’s unending greed, self-entitlement, and lack of moral compass has an immeasurable negative impact on our community. Recently, they deceitfully ousted tax paying home owners on Belden, destroying neighbors’ lives and what was once an idyllic residential street. They create dangerous gridlock on public streets and have the overall belief they can do and take whatever they please.  This MUST stop!
Safety and jobs. Period. Stay focused. And no Covid restrictions! No DEI.

City personnel working with established community organizations and or not-for-profit organizations and associations to identify and articulate the problems  and needs facing the neighborhood, and the resources, and potential present in the neighborhoods to turn problems into new possibilities.
Streets full of pot holes all over the area
The graffiti and litter in the neighborhood are greater than I’ve ever seen in my 20 years in Lincoln Park. It’s a visual representation of an out-of-control city.
Cps school support and improvement - including crossing guards and mitigation for carjacking that was attempted during 3:45 pick up
lowering property taxes
Crime and lack of CPD
An alderman who is smart, accessible, independent, has knowledge about and a genuine commitment to ward and the city.
Close the redline at Clark & division
We need to have more police presence to reduce crime, especially on the weekends in the warmer months.
Planned development to permit more than million dollar mansions on side streets.  Treating condo owners, renters, and homeowners equally.
Public safety- this deserves a second vote
Lower our property taxes!!!
Noise from street- street racing, loud music on cars, mufflers; removing electric scooters from sidewalks

My two hot topics for the 43rd Ward are the removal of any notion of installing the Dickens Greenway - it is not good for the neighborhood for many reasons. We already have a bike path on Armitage. The other topic is safety - we need to stop the muggings and car jackings. I have been a lincoln park resident for nearly 20 years and this is the absolute worst.

I would like to see someone nominated to fill Alderman Smith's seat that does not intend to run for the seat in the spring. This would allow the people of the Ward to have input versus someone running as an incumbent.
Public Education
prosecuting violent offenders instead of returning them to the street
Park improvements/more allocation of land to parks

Prosecute criminals - Too many carjacking 
Property taxes
Crime in our area has gotten worse over the past two years and needs to be dealt with.  Arresting the violators and then putting them back on the street is NOT the way to deal with crime!!
Want area rezoned for 24 hour permit parking.

Public safety that DOES NOT involve more policing. I do not need the police to come to my business, I need service workers that are professionals dealing with substance abuse and mental health issues. Deescalation training should be something the city can provide and pay for to bars & taverns.
Carjackings and shootings
Clearly crime such brasinness like the Wild West a century ago

Rampant crime. It is destroying the fabric of our community. People are afraid to go out at night in a neighborhood where we once felt safe. It will destroy the desirability of living here, impact business etc.We pay huge property taxes, which I as a retired person am increasing unable to afford , and then see that people walking down the street, or riding the el, are shot for their cell phones is really disturbing

When I read some of the issues lower they’re not important.  It’s  that compared to crime crime is 100 and everything else is a nine. If I can’t feel safe walking the streets of Chicago with my family so I have to leave chicago all the other issues which I feel personally are important don’t matter. 

That’s why this ranking is not capturing the sense of urgency chicagoans feel about crime
Taxes need to be lowered
CRIME! our city is under seige. Michelle Smith had the courage to stand up with the Lincoln park residents. Her departure is a signal for us to leave Illinois now
Public safety again special attention to car jacking and armed robbery and street crimes in our neighborhood
Improve and expand (back to what use to be provided) city services — trash and 311

Crime has been out of control in Chgo for 2.5 yrs. Chgo is ranked #1 as the most dangerous city in the U.S. Gun control is NOT the issue. Pls address the actual ROOT problem. Proper upbringing in a 2-parent home with a father who is NOT a gang member. Oprah can certainly help with this effort. Chgo made her a millionaire. Until the root problem is resolved in black communities, Chgo will never change.There must be a way to inspire men to be better role models for the many children they create.

The city's financial insolvency.  The city if facing financial ruin due to the state of the pension funds and the stupid fiscal mismanagement of this and prior administrations.  What is to be done that does not involve massive tax increases?

Not surprisingly, crime - particularly in the 43rd ward is rising, becoming more brazen, and has changed the way we live in our beloved city. We are always looking over our shoulders. Please fix this. It’s terrifying.
Na

Public Safety is marked as 5, the highest priority, in that the other items’ success hinge on public safety with the exception of Climate and Sustainability.  This is the only other 5 o marked because there is no time to lost on this topic.
Basic services are not getting done in the ward.  Garbage pickup, potholes being filled, permit approvals, police walking their beat.

Two:
1) controlling / cleaning up the garbage in the alley ways, primarily left by the ‘’mixed’’ apt. buildings, thereby also controlling the rampant rat problem. 
2) effectively cleaning the streets by side moly coordinating the removal of the parked cars before street cleaners arrive.
Likely part of “Public Safety,” but wanted specifically to call out crime!

Building way more housing, protected networked bike lanes, and bus lanes will do a ton to foster new businesses, make housing more affordable, and make people safer, while addressing climate, improving equity, and creating jobs. Upzone everything! Build lots of housing! Cover all parking lots with big buildings with business and housing! And make it safe for people who aren't SUV owners to get to them!

The city needs to do a better job of being perceived as friendly to business from a tax, budget  and regulatory perspective. Reasons for businesses leaving Chicago are of course related to the perception of runaway crime ( even if that is not really accurate)  but also the general climate for business. Unfortunately Chicago's image as a corrupt government ( again not necessarily accurate) has to change.
We have a great city here and we need to deal with the problems and stress the strengths.
Biggest issue is crime.  Youths who commit crime with a gun & then are released to do it again.
ghost buses on the cta

Crime and crowd control along North Avenue and at North Avenue Beach is an urgent concern. Also crowd control, traffic and crime prevention during the Air & Water Show. This annual show has become a dreadful event that has become way too big for its location. Businesses along North Avenue close for that weekend because of the crowds and traffic. This event should be moved to some other location such as Navy Pier or Northerly Island.

Large events on the lake shore (the air show) and downtown (nascar and lalapsloosa) are dangerous, disruptive for residents and counterproductive to any effort to protect and preserve the city from all the factors that threaten it.
Want all focus on public safety, jail time for violent and repeat offenders, and economic empowerment for small businesses.
street/pothole repair

Garbage clean up especially along lakeshore drive and the expressways! Looks terrible. Also fencing which is rusted and run down along the drive from Oak to Fullerton is horrifying and conveys a bad image of what was our most pristine neighborhood!
Traffic control near the Zoo

The new alderman should be dedicated to an abundant housing agenda. They should support citywide legislation that will remove barriers to dense housing and support by-right housing development to reduce regulatory barriers and selfish NIMBY interests. More housing means cheaper housing and a more equitable Chicago.

Crack down on lawless drivers. For instance, u-turners at intersections frequently. Cars running red lights. Cars not even stopping at stop signs at 5:30 am when walking to the bus/el. Cars parked at bus stops. Cars parked in alleys. Cars/trucks cutting through alleys (Howe-Orchard just south of Armitage)
Crime! Safety! Closing late night bars - revoke licenses
Crime
More Police presence. How about tree trimming?
Crime reduction in city at large with harsher punishments and strict gun laws
Education - investing in our public schools
Overdevelopment in this ward. We need green space. There is only one park in this area and it serves a large area. And keeping vintage, historic buildings. Stop the bulldozing for more high rises.
City road conditions. Some of the streets need resurfacing and repainting. They are in bad shape.
Crime, carjacking and gun use is out of control.  Must be addressed.
Population density and diminished green space.  There is a need to maintain neighborhood character and stop building high-rise buildings with inadequate parking and no green space.
Public safety and responsiveness to the community
Bob Fioretti would be a great candidate
Education
This ward needs diversity and revitalization. Greedy developers have all but destroyed it as a community. We need affordable housing affordable rents for people and small business

The "boy racers" on Lake Shore Drive and all over the neighborhood.  The "parties" of young people at North ave beach that make it not a fun place in the eveings and the LOUD music from North Ave beach.  Maybe some type of consequence for anyone on social media who advertises these events and reposts them.
The crushing overcrowding and potentially disastrous development of Lincoln Yards -- especially in terms of traffic and expressway accessibility and lack of green space.
Armed robberies. Put the guilty in jail.
Fix the crime - that is the biggest issue and following right behind is to bring business's and the economy back to the city.
Lower property taxes!!

Someone responsive who actively votes and leads on city issues. 

Need to be tough on criminals and follow up until they are prosecuted and put in jail. Not let out on electronic monitoring.
Start prosecuting the criminals - enough with the slap on wrist
Parks and open space
People respect and safety more diversity in are wars

Crime in this neighborhood (armed robbery, car jacking, mugging, etc.) has never been so high! We have lived in Lincoln Park for 18 years and have never felt so unsafe — to the point of being scared to walk to a local restaurant in daylight. This must change! We cannot otherwise remain in the city!
Individual response to constituents
Public safety (its that darn important that it gets a 2nd vote from me.)

There is a growing tension between the Parker Community and residents due to past business dealings. I would like the next alderman to have more objectivity and less political ties with Parker’s board, Bill Singer, or anyone affiliated with those responsible for reducing affordable housing to increase the expansion of Parker, whose tax dollars do not benefit our community; whose traffic wears down our roads, increases traffic congestion, and endangers CPS students and bikers. This is not equity.
Reduce city budgets
Stop the motorcycles on LSD
More and improved natural green space

The safety and security of all residents in Lincoln Park is the MOST important issue our neighborhood faces today.  We need a heavier police presence throughout the ward at all times.  Having lived in Lincoln Park for over 20 years, I have never felt LESS safe than I do today (and for the past 2 years).
Safety is a problem in our ward. I am afraid to walk my dog after dark.
Improving the image and reputation of Chicago outside the City

I marked "other" because this survey would not let me submit it until I marked ALL rows.
I think your survey covered all the big issues adequately.
Public safety, Keep green space, support small local businesses
Violent Crime.
